dmca.title: Stock Website Wants Alleged Infringer Removed from Google
dmca.body:
Our work "Turtle Trading Techniques" Copyright 1996-2001 TurtleTrader is being infringed. Someone has taken a version of our written materials -- proprietary and copyrighted material -- and put it on Google for free.

1. Search query: stig ostgaard
Infringing webpages: http://www.forexnet.lv/admin/Portal/LinkClick.aspx?tabid=590&table=dnn_CsDocument&field=ItemID&id=74&link=Turtle+Trading+Techniques.pdf

2. Search query: "atr stop" variance
Infringing webpages: http:/lwww.forexnet.lv/adminlPortal/LinkClick.aspx?tabid=590&table=dnn_CsDocument&field=ItemID&id=74&link=Turtle+Trading+Techniques.pdf

We do not have a contact for this Russian firm and frankly we worry that an attempt to contact them will result in further problems. We simply want Google to stop listing these infringing links in Google's search results.

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly offending web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. I swear, under the penalty of perjury consistent with United States Code Title 17, Section 512, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Sincerely,
[private] President, TurtleTrader
